articles.description: The racing commentator, speaking for the first time since the murder of his wife and two daughters, says their love has helped sustain him through grief.
articles.title: My wife and daughters left behind a legacy of love, John Hunt tells BBC

articles.description: Australia are skittled out for just 180 against West Indies but hit back late on as 14 wickets fall on a chaotic opening day of the first Test in Bridgetown.
articles.title: West Indies v Australia: Tourists out for 180 but hit back late on chaotic opening day

articles.description: Despite a frustrating season with Liverpool that has left his future in doubt, Harvey Elliott showed his talent with a matchwinning display to send England Under-21s into a second successive Euros final.
articles.title: England Under-21s: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott proves he will be one of Europe's hottest properties this summer

articles.description: British number one Emma Raducanu succumbs to defeat by teenager Maya Joint in an edgy second-round match at Eastbourne.
articles.title: Eastbourne: Emma Raducanu loses to Maya Joint in second round, Jodie Burrage beaten by Barbora Krejcikova

articles.description: Sir Andy Murray says he is trying to protect his children from "damaging" social media platforms as he supports more action following Katie Boulter's BBC interview.
articles.title: Sir Andy Murray: British Wimbledon tennis legend says social media is damaging as he backs Katie Boulter

articles.description: As Gareth Southgate becomes Sir Gareth, BBC Sport looks at the short list of managerial greats he joins in receiving the honour.
articles.title: Gareth Southgate knighthood: Former England boss joins list of football greats as he becomes Sir Gareth

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at how Ben Stokes has struck fear into the opposition with his side's ability to seemingly chase any target in English conditions.
articles.title: England vs India: Ben Stokes' side rip up rulebook with supreme run chases

articles.description: Rally legend Carlos Sainz decides not to run for the presidency of motorsport's governing body the FIA in December's election.
articles.title: FIA: Carlos Sainz rules out election presidency bid as 'circumstances not ideal'

articles.description: A Spanish court dismisses various appeals from Rubiales and prosecutors over his February sexual assault conviction.
articles.title: Luis Rubiales, former Spanish football chief, lose World Cup kiss appeal

articles.description: Archie Goodburn was 21 when he was told he had brain cancer. A year on, he's still competing and still fighting to help others.
articles.title: Archie Goodburn: The Commonwealth Games swimmer who might not see 40
